create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_8::t: Practice taking photos with two distinct layers, one with a clear subject and another that provides context. Take several photos and work on different ways to use layers
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_0::t: Layers help the two dimensional space of a photograph better represent the three-dimensional world.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_5::t: Sometimes it can be effective to reverse the subject and context layers.
create_layers_in_a_photo::clip_card_0::g: Place the subject or character in a distinct layer from the rest of the image.
create_layers_in_a_photo::preview_card_3: In this photo the subject layer is in color.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_3::t: The second layer, often the background layer, can be composed to help the viewer better understand a subject's environment and more about the story.
create_layers_in_a_photo::preview_card_2: In this photo, the background is in color
create_layers_in_a_photo::howto_card_0::: The card below is a clip card. Select “Capture” to launch the camera and take a photo.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_1::t: To create depth in a photo, compose in distinct layers: foreground and background. Sometimes a third layer, a middle ground, is used.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_4::t: The most basic application of this idea for photojournalism is to create two distinct layers: a subject layer and a second layer that provides context to the story.
create_layers_in_a_photo::preview_card_1: In this photo the foreground is in color.
create_layers_in_a_photo::preview_card_4: You can emphasize the context of your story in an image through where you place the layer.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_6::t: Complex photographs may have three layers, each illustrating a different element of the story.
create_layers_in_a_photo::title: Create Layers in a Photo
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_7::t: Next, see if you can create photos that use layers to improve your composition.
create_layers_in_a_photo::text_card_2::t: The main subject of your photo can be a person or an object. It should be placed on one distinct layer of the frame.
